N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 519.22 - Decision after hearing

State Regulations
(a) A written hearing decision will be made
by the commissioner or by a person designated to act on behalf of the
commissioner and must be based exclusively on the record and testimony
introduced at the hearing. (b) The
decision will be issued as promptly as possible, but in any event within 120
days of the conclusion of the hearing or the closing of the record. The
decision must describe the issues, recite the relevant facts, the pertinent
provisions of law, regulation and State-approved policy, make appropriate
findings, determine the issues, state reasons for the determinations, and when
appropriate, direct specific action. (c) The decision is the final agency action
and is binding upon the parties. (d) A copy of the decision will be sent to
each of the parties and their representatives, if any. (e) In the letter transmitting the decision, clear reference must be made to the availability of judicial review by the
appellant, if the decision is adverse to the appellant, either in whole or in
part. Notes
